petitioner: Alex M. Azar, II, Secretary of Health and Human Services, et al.
respondent: Rochelle Garza, as Guardian ad Litem to Unaccompanied Minor J. D.
lowerCourt: United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit

wikiData.title: Azar v. Garza
wikiData.FullName: [[Alex Azar]], II, Secretary of Health and Human Services, et al. v. Rochelle Garza, as [[guardian ad litem]] to unaccompanied minor J. D.
wikiData.Prior: ''Temporary restraining order granted'', ''Garza v. Hargan'', [https://www.courtlistener.com/docket/6170061/20/garza-v-hargan/ No. 1:17-cv–02122] ([[D.D.C.]] Oct. 18, 2017); ''vacated in part'', D.C. Cir., Oct. 19, 2017; ''vacated and remanded'', [https://scholar.google.com/scholar_case?case=10484534704636527850 874 F. 3d 735] (D.C. Cir. 2017) (''en banc'')
wikiData.Holding: Judgment below should be vacated and remanded with a direction to dismiss when a federal civil case has become moot while on its way to the Supreme Court.
wikiData.LawsApplied: [[Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|U.S. Const. amend. XIV]]
